page.title: 07GLYN CEIRIOG SLATE MINE.
page.content: The Chwarel Wynne slate mine and museum is in Glyn Ceiriog and its ownership can be traced to the 1750's when it was in the possession of Edward Wynne. Mining continued in a nearby quarry until the winter of 1946 when part of the mine was flooded. The building that is used today as a museum,once housed steam driven winding machinery.Various trucks and tools used above and below ground are on display. Visitors can walk down the mine with a guide and see full sized models of men at work. The trip under ground lasts 20 _ 30mins. Back above ground there are other attractions e.g.nature walk, a video commentary on slate quarrying, a shop,an aviary and a small restaurant.
